[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Character encoding] Does the parser properly handle non-ASCII characters, UTF-8 multibyte sequences, or invalid Unicode? Can encoding attacks bypass validation or cause crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Canonicalization] Can multiple string representations parse to the same FunctionInfo (e.g., different address formats: 0x1 vs 0x01 vs 0x0001)? Can this lead to replay attacks or governance proposal manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Serialization consistency] Is the MoveValue::Struct serialization deterministic across all validators? Can non-deterministic serialization lead to different state roots and consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Field ordering] Does the vec![...] maintain the correct field order (module_address, module_name, function_name)? Can incorrect ordering cause type mismatches or crashes in Move VM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Type safety] Can the MoveStruct::Runtime variant bypass Move's type system, allowing attackers to inject values that violate Move type constraints and cause undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [String conversion] When module_name.as_move_value() is called, can malicious strings exploit the String to MoveValue conversion to inject invalid byte sequences or cause buffer overflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Address encoding] Is MoveValue::Address encoding consistent with Move's address representation? Can encoding mismatches cause address resolution failures or security bypasses in Move code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Memory corruption] Can the vec! macro allocate insufficient memory for large strings, leading to buffer overflows when the MoveValue is processed by the Move VM? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Gas metering] Is gas properly metered for the as_move_value() conversion? Can attackers craft FunctionInfo with large strings to consume excessive gas without proper accounting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Function: as_move_value()] [Clone safety] Does the String::clone() in as_move_value implementation handle large strings safely? Can repeated clones cause memory exhaustion in transaction processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Transaction Validation] [Prologue bypass] Can an attacker craft a malicious FunctionInfo that resolves to a fake prologue function, bypassing signature verification, sequence number checks, or gas payment validation, allowing unauthorized transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Transaction Validation] [Epilogue manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate FunctionInfo to point to a malicious epilogue function that skips gas charging, allowing free transactions and economic denial-of-service attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Transaction Validation] [Function resolution race] During transaction validation, can concurrent modifications to FunctionInfo lead to race conditions where different validators resolve to different prologue/epilogue functions, causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Transaction Validation] [System function impersonation] Can an attacker create a FunctionInfo that impersonates system validation functions (script_prologue, multi_agent_prologue), gaining unauthorized access to privileged operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Transaction Validation] [Cross-session contamination] If FunctionInfo is reused across multiple transaction validation sessions, can state from previous transactions leak into subsequent validations, causing security violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Governance] [Proposal execution bypass] Can an attacker craft a governance proposal with malicious FunctionInfo that executes arbitrary functions with governance privileges, bypassing voting and approval mechanisms? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Governance] [Function substitution] Can an attacker modify FunctionInfo in a governance proposal between voting and execution phases, causing validators to execute a different function than what was approved? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Governance] [Privilege escalation] Can FunctionInfo be used to call privileged governance functions (aptos_governance::resolve, voting::create_proposal) from unauthorized contexts, escalating privileges? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Integration: Governance] [Module upgrade attack] During protocol upgrades, can attackers inject malicious FunctionInfo that redirects governance execution to compromised module versions, hijacking the upgrade process? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Serde deserialization] Can maliciously crafted serialized FunctionInfo bypass validation during deserialization, injecting invalid data that passes Serde checks but fails semantic validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Version compatibility] Are FunctionInfo serialization formats backward/forward compatible? Can version mismatches during upgrades cause deserialization failures or state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Hash collision] Can two different FunctionInfo instances with malicious field values produce the same hash, causing hash table collisions and function resolution conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Serialization size] Is there a maximum size limit for serialized FunctionInfo? Can attackers create bloated instances that exceed network packet sizes or storage limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Deterministic serialization] Does Serde guarantee deterministic serialization order for FunctionInfo fields? Can non-deterministic ordering cause validators to produce different serialized outputs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/function_info.rs] [Struct: FunctionInfo] [Clone safety] Is the Clone implementation thread-safe for FunctionInfo? Can concurrent clones of the same instance cause data races in module_name or function_name strings? (High)
